title: Asian Pear & Cabrales Salad With Fig & Port Dressing
summary: Asian Pear & Cabrales Salad With Fig & Port Dressing is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan side dish. This recipe serves 6 and costs $1.14 per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 1g of protein, 0g of fat, and a total of 76 calories. Head to the store and pick up cider vinegar, figs, ruby port, and a few other things to make it today. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 18%. This score is rather bad. Try Cabrales Cheese Souffles with Endive and Asian Pear Salad, Fresh Pear Salad with Asian Sesame Dressing, and Asian Pear and Grapefruit Salad with Sake Granitan and Pear Sorbet for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Asian works really well with Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. One wine you could try is Union Sacre Belle de Nuit Dry Gewurztraminer. It has 4.2 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 18 dollars.

productMatches.title: Union Sacre Belle de Nuit Dry Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: Gew√ºrztraminer is difficult to capture, on the vine it will go from pitch-perfect to over-ripe in a number of hours. As wine, it has an amazingly wide breadth of characteristics that it can display, it can be spice-driven, floral, sweet, bone-chillingly dry, clear, orange or pink. When it is done well it is a thing of rare, fleeting beauty that will last decades, much like the memory of a beautiful woman met once and disappeared.
